title: Zucchini Walnut Bread
description: This moist zucchini bread recipe features succulent raisins and chewy walnuts that enhance this quick bread flavored with cinnamon spice and vanilla.
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) with rack in lowest position. Grease and lightly flour two 9x5-inch loaf pans.
Whisk flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, and baking powder together in a bowl until well combined. Set aside.

Beat eggs in a large bowl until smooth; gradually beat in sugar until well combined. Stir in oil; add flour mixture, alternating with zucchini. Stir in raisins, walnuts, and vanilla extract until incorporated. Divide batter between the prepared pans.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into centers comes out clean, about 55 minutes. Cool for 10 minutes in the pans, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.
author: [{'@type': 'Person', 'name': 'Barbara Domurat'}]

featured_tweaks.text: It was perfect just as shown. A 9x5 pan is the one to use for proper baking. Not sweet and I even tossed in a few Choc chips. May top with something fun next time for guests. My husband and I don’t need the sugar though.

this zuchinni bread has perfect amount of moist in the center. this made me 2 loaves that i baked for 1 hour and i added some nutmeg to add some spice. i also added more zuchinni because my mom grows them. the raisins add the perfect touch

This was so good! I did tweak it a bit, but I always like to add a bit extra ;) I doubled the recipe and replaced a cup of the zucchini with some grated carrots because my zucchini wasn’t big enough, and it added a lovely color to the bread when I cut it. I used golden raisins instead of regular because I like the flavor and look of them better, as well. I also replaced half of the white sugar with brown to give it a richer flavor and color. Finally, I added some more spices like nutmeg and clove and extra cinnamon. Fabulous recipe!
